definition.name: Button
definition.purpose: A flexible and styleable button component supporting variants and sizes
definition.description: A reusable button component that supports multiple visual variants (default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link) and sizes (default, sm, lg, icon). It can render as a native button or as a child component using Slot for advanced composition. It applies consistent styling and accessibility features.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the button

variant.description: Visual style of the button (default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link)

size.description: Size of the button (default, sm, lg, icon)

asChild.description: If true, renders as a child component using Slot

initial.data: Button with default variant and size

visible: Button element with text or children

effects: onClick handler is called if provided

visible: Button element with reduced opacity and pointer-events none

definition.visualLayout: Inline-flex button with customizable styles, supporting icons and different sizes/variants
definition.implementationNotes: Uses class-variance-authority for variant and size management, Radix Slot for advanced composition, and a utility for class name merging

declarations.name: buttonVariants
declarations.description: A utility function created by class-variance-authority (cva) to generate class names for the Button component based on variant and size props. It provides a consistent API for styling buttons with different visual appearances and sizes.

returns.description: A string of CSS class names to apply to the button

declarations.implementationNotes: Uses cva to manage class name logic for variants and sizes. Used internally by the Button component.
